summary: This document is an email chain from June 2020 regarding a Touhy request for tangible and documentary evidence in the civil case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al. (SDNY Case No. 1:20-cv-004114-MK-DCF). An attorney is following up with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) to expedite their client's request for evidence.

persons.name: Indyke
persons.context: Named defendant in the civil lawsuit Jane Doe v. Indyke et al., which is the subject of the evidence request.

events.title: Initial Touhy Request Submission
events.description: An attorney sent a formal request (Touhy Request) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for tangible and documentary evidence related to the case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al.

events.title: Follow-up on Evidence Request
events.description: An attorney followed up with the U.S. Attorney's Office to urge expedited compliance with their client's earlier Touhy request for evidence.

keyFacts: A civil lawsuit, Jane Doe v. Indyke et al., was active in the Southern District of New York in June 2020 (Case No. 1:20-cv-004114-MK-DCF).
An attorney made a Touhy request to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) for evidence related to the case.
The correspondence shows legal efforts to obtain government-held evidence for use in the civil litigation.
The document is subject to a protective order restricting the disclosure of certain paragraphs.
The email chain includes a standard confidentiality notice from a law firm.
